result.reason: RemoteConnectionsSyncronizer polls SQL every 3s and does a full tree reload on any change, causing visible flicker and hourglass cursor in multi-user scenarios
result.approach: Wrap tree reload during sync with BeginUpdate/EndUpdate to prevent flicker, suppress WaitCursor during background sync polls, and consider merging changes into existing tree model instead of full rebuild

attempts.raw_output:
Now I have a clear understanding of the issue. The `RemoteConnectionsSyncronizer` polls every 3 seconds and triggers a **full `LoadConnections()` reload** whenever any other user saves. This causes the tree to be entirely rebuilt, causing flicker and hourglass cursor.
